feed.title: Category: picks | User group for Viennese rubyists

entry.title: Picks / what the vienna.rb team thinks is worth sharing this week
entry.content:
01/11 Picks!

In a series on this website we’ll entertain YOU with our picks - or: what we think is worth sharing - every week. Books, articles, gems, fun stuff… you’re in for an eclectic mix! So, here’s for the one-hundred-ninety-third edition:

Ramón
  • vim-nerdtree-tabs - A Vim plugin allowing NERDtree and tabs to work together.
  • Memrise - Free-ish platform for learning spoken languages, with videos of natives speaking!
  • Vienna BEAMers - A bi-weekly Elixir study group held here in Vienna.
Markus
  • Ruby 2.4 Released: Faster Hashes, Unified Integers and Better Rounding
  • How to ask good questions - An essential guide.
  • Writing software is hard - We all know it, but we’re still shocked when we encounter bad software.
Max
  • Building an Umbrella Project - Awesome talk on Elixir (& Phoenix) umbrella apps vs. microservices.
  • rubocop_runner - Nifty little tool used at Runtastic to prevent devs from committing non-Rubocop-confirm code.

entry.title: Picks / what the vienna.rb team thinks is worth sharing this week
entry.content:
01/04 Picks!

In a series on this website we’ll entertain YOU with our picks - or: what we think is worth sharing - every week. Books, articles, gems, fun stuff… you’re in for an eclectic mix! So, here’s for the one-hundred-ninety-second edition:

Markus
  • Jessica Rose - Imposter Syndrome and Individual Competence
  • Is the Ballmer Peak real? - From this XKCD comic.
  • Choose an open source license - It’s a new year, you might have made a resolution to make a new open source project, and you’ll need a license for it.

entry.title: Picks / what the vienna.rb team thinks is worth sharing this week
entry.content:
12/28 Picks!

In a series on this website we’ll entertain YOU with our picks - or: what we think is worth sharing - every week. Books, articles, gems, fun stuff… you’re in for an eclectic mix! So, here’s for the one-hundred-ninety-first edition:

Markus
  • Why is a BasicObject a Range?
  • Just because you have been doing it doesn’t mean you are doing it right
  • 10 Modern Software Over-Engineering Mistakes

entry.title: Picks / what the vienna.rb team thinks is worth sharing this week
entry.content:
12/21 Picks!

In a series on this website we’ll entertain YOU with our picks - or: what we think is worth sharing - every week. Books, articles, gems, fun stuff… you’re in for an eclectic mix! So, here’s for the one-hundred-ninetieth edition:

Markus
  • Web Design: The First Hundred Years with Maciej Ceglowski
  • I’m a boring programmer (and proud of it) - We’re all suckers for excitement, but in your job, being boring can be a big advantage.
  • Kill all the mutants - a deep dive into mutation testing and how the Mutant gem works

entry.title: Picks / what the vienna.rb team thinks is worth sharing this week
entry.content:
12/14 Picks!

In a series on this website we’ll entertain YOU with our picks - or: what we think is worth sharing - every week. Books, articles, gems, fun stuff… you’re in for an eclectic mix! So, here’s for the one-hundred-eighty-ninth edition:

Markus
  • The Best Password Managers - The Wirecutter looks at the best password managers out there. If you don’t use one already, take a look, then pick one.
  • Decrypting TLS Browser Traffic With Wireshark – The Easy Way! - Sometimes, you do need to debug TLS traffic. With this trick, you can even do it when you use certificate pinning.
  • A Comprehensive Guide to Terraform - Terraform is a tool to programatically provide & manage infrastructure - both servers and software.
Max
  • DRY up your domain models using a struct table - Unconventional but super neat refactoring technique.
  • Clean your desk - Second in a series of posts causing shitstorms at Amazon (quite rightly).
  • I Think It’s a Fish - Funny, trolly episode of the Bike Shed with insights on day-to-day (open source) work.
